texts.text:
What is so pure as grief? A wreck
set sail just to be wrecked again.
To lose what’s lost–it’s all born lost
and we just fetch it for a little while,
a dandelion span, a quarter-note.
Each day an envelope gummed shut
with honey and mud....
texts.author: Melissa Stein
texts.title: Lemon and cedar

texts.text:
Who has seen the wind?
Neither I nor you:
But when the leaves hang trembling,
 The wind is passing through.

 Who has seen the wind?
 Neither you nor I:
 But when the trees bow down their heads,
 The wind is passing by.
texts.author: Christina Rossetti
texts.title: Who Has Seen the Wind?

texts.text:
All the complicated details
of the attiring and
the disattiring are completed!
A liquid moon
moves gently among
the long branches.
Thus having prepared their buds
against a sure winter
the wise trees
stand sleeping in the cold.
texts.author: William Carlos Williams
texts.title: Winter Trees

texts.text:
Maple leaves turn black in the courtyard.
Light drives lower and one bluejay crams
our cold memories out past the sun,

each time your traces come past the shadows
and visit under my looking-glass fingers
that lift and block out the sun.

 Come—I’ll trace you one final autumn,
 and you can trace your last homecoming
 into the snow or the sun.
texts.author: Annie Finch
texts.title: Final Autumn

texts.text:
Do not take life too seriously.
You will never get out of it alive.
texts.author: Elbert Hubbard

texts.text: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
texts.author: Jules Renard

texts.text: I'm sorry, if you were right, I'd agree with you.
texts.author: Robin Williams

texts.text: I can resist everything except temptation.
texts.author: Oscar Wilde

texts.text:
An old silent pond...
A frog jumps into the pond,
splash! Silence again.
texts.author: Matsuo Basho

texts.text:
In the moonlight,
The color and scent of the wisteria
Seems far away.
texts.author: Yosa Buson

texts.text:
A little boy sings
on a terrace, eyes aglow.
Ridge spills upward.
texts.author: Robert Yehling

texts.text:
ground squirrel
balancing its tomato
on the garden fence
texts.author: Don Eulert
